addressleaf.section: A Monsieur Monsieur Sidney chevalier et Governeur de la ville de Vlissingnes

page.lettertext:
fol.278r
S
r
Tho Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
I doe rather salute yo
r
L. for
at this bea-
rer doth come so fittely, then for any kinde
of mater
at is worthy of a letter. For
heere at
e Hage there is nothing sturring:
and we have litle from
e campe, but yo
r
L. hath it quickly. they are busied at
this p
nt
present
in drieng up
e ditche: w
ch
is easely
done, if there come no raine, and so, it is
thought, they shall be masters of
e place.
There is other wise litle hope, as
e occurr
e
ce
goeth heere. The levie of
Juliers
doth
daily repaire to
e towne of
Sherembergh,
so as many men [gaine] out,
at there are at
this present 700 at
e lest. Besides their
forces out of
France
are expected to returne
w
t
e very first winde: w
ch
will make
in all a good supplie, for
e w
t
drawing
of
e Englishe: w
ch
I see her
Hig
nes
is resol-
ved to send for by
e next. But of
at
I thinke yo
r
L. knoweth more then my
self.
For w
ch
I will not now trouble w
t
intelligence of no moment, but c
o
mend yo
w
most earnestly to Gods good protecti
o
.
Fr
o
e Hage. Au
g
11 1592
Yo
r
L. at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley
